Title: Delta Assembly passes N1.73tr 2026 Budget, raises allocation beyond governor’s proposal
Summary: Delta State House of Assembly approved a ₦1.73 trillion Appropriation Bill for the 2026 fiscal year . This move has reignited discussion over legislative amendments, fiscal discipline . Delta Assembly raised the budget beyond Governor Sheriff Oborevwori’s original proposal by � 65.6 billion .

Title: NCoS, NHIA move to integrate inmates in national health insurance coverage
Summary: The Nigerian Correctional Service (NCoS) and the National Health Insurance Authority (NHIA) have announced a collaborative effort to integrate inmates into the national health insurance coverage . The initiative aims to ensure that all individuals, including those in correctional facilities, have national insurance .

Title: Oyo @50: Makinde unveils logo, vows continued devt amid national challenges
Summary: Governor Seyi Makinde, on Monday, affirmed that the state has achieved remarkable progress despite economic and security challenges facing the nation . The governor made the remarks during the unveiling ceremony of the state's logo .

Title: 2027: Tinubu’s support groups in Ondo legitimate – APC chair
Summary: The Chairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Ondo State chapter, Ade Adetimehin, has cautioned against any misrepresentation of the activities of the multitude of support groups in the state . He said their efforts are legitimate and should be viewed as legitimate .

Title: African SMEs lose $38b in export opportunities annually – Expert
Summary: The Chief Executive Officer/Founder, Valcertra, Prof. Benard Odoh, has stated that African small and medium enterprises forfeit an estimated $38 billion in export opportunities each year . He also lamented Africa’s marginal participation in global trade, noting that the continent accounts for only about 10 per cent of global trade .

Title: Kashamu defects from PDP to APC
Summary: Kashamu defected citing irreconcilable differences and divisions leading to the polarisation of the party at the State and national levels . Kashimu said he was disappointed with the party's polarisation at the national and state levels .

Title: NANS demands Matawalle’s sack over alleged links to banditry
Summary: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) has called for the immediate removal of the Minister of State for Defence, Bello Matawalle .

Title: Bayelsa Gov, elders, Tompolo, INEC pay condolence visit over late Deputy Gov’s passing
Summary: Bayelsa State Governor, Senator Douye Diri, and the family of his late deputy, Senator Lawrence Ewhrudjakpo, received numerous condolence visits at the Government House, Yenagoa .

Title: 2027 election will define Nigeria’s democracy — Anambra ADC guber candidate
Summary: The African Democratic Congress (ADC) candidate in the November 8 Anambra State election, John Nwosu, has described the 2027 general election as a defining moment for Nigeria’s democracy .

Title: Delta Police arrest 627 suspected criminals, recover 144 arms and N36m ransom
Summary: Delta State Police Command has arrested 627 suspected criminals and recovered 144 arms and N36m ransom . The Delta State police command has recovered a wide array of weapons, ammunition, and ransom monies .

Title: Yuletide: Police boost security for festive season in Ogun, restate fireworks ban
Summary: The Ogun State Police Command has unveiled comprehensive security operations to ensure the safety of lives and property before, during, and after the 2025 Christmas and New Year celebrations . The initiative forms part of the state’s police proactive measures to maintain public order during the festive period . The ban on the sale and use of fireworks, knockouts

Title: Lobi Stars suspend technical adviser over poor performance
Summary: The suspension follows an emergency meeting of the club’s Director of Media and Communications, John Onuh . The suspension comes after the club was relegated from the Premier League .

Title: Dangote appoints ex-CBN director as chief economist
Summary: The Dangote Group has appointed renowned economist and former Central Bank of Nigeria Director, Dr Mahmud Hassan, as its Group Chief Economist . Hassan will serve as the Group’s top adviser on economic strategy, market trends, and policy implications . Hassan brings more than 30 years of experience in economic policy formulation, financial sector regulation,

Title: Police foil robbery in Enugu, arrest suspect
Summary: The Enugu State Police Command on Monday foiled an armed robbery attempt and arrested a suspect near Agric Bank Bus Stop, Independence Layout, in Enugu metropolis . The suspect, Chimuanya Oshim, 28, was arrested on December 13, around 11:30 p.m., while attempting to rob members of the public .

Title: Accord Party disowns Imumolen, backs Adeleke's candidacy
Summary: A faction of the Accord Party launched a legal action before the High Court of the Federal Capital Territory, Abuja, seeking to void the party’s forthcoming Osun State governorship primaries . The suit, filed on December 3, 202,5 and marked FCT/CV/4955/2025, was instituted by Oliver
